characterDescription:
Hariel was once Demid, who sacrificed himself to resurrect one of the Fused by embracing the power of the Everstorm.
Addressing her as "good servant," he tells Venli that he regrets the death of her friend.
Further, that though she and her compatriots are the children of traitors, their war there is to be commended. He tells her that they faced their hereditary enemies and gave no quarter, even when doomed.
When Venli tells Hariel that Demid was precious to her, and asks him if he can return him, Hariel tells her that Demid has passed into the blindness beyond.
He then tells her that she was to bear a soul he has fought beside for thousands of years. That this soul was turned away, and she was reserved. He tells her that Odium has a purpose for her. That she should revel in that, and mourn not the passing of her friend. That Odium will bring vengeance at long last to those they fight.
